definition: anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng

sentences.english: Finally, the Yang Sen's over-anxious and compulsory policy should be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对杨森的急于求成和强制政策要给予批评。

sentences.english: A man in such a hurry as you are to get results seldom learns quickly.
sentences.chinese: 一个人向你这样急于求成是不会有很快进步的。

sentences.english: We are not in a rush for quick results, since the reform should advance gradually in due order.
sentences.chinese: 我们不急于求成，改革要循序渐进地推进。

sentences.english: But I have the impression they are getting too ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 但我的感觉是他们过于急于求成。

sentences.english: But China does not want to rush.
sentences.chinese: 但中国并不想急于求成。

sentences.english: We belong to a generation that wants to see the results of our work.
sentences.chinese: 我们属于急于求成的一代人。

definition: seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
to advance prematurely
blind/blindly/ignorant/lacking understanding
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
to produce the opposite of the desired result
irritable/irascible/impetuous
